document.bingtitle: low coolant light - W-body.com Community - The Front Page
document.description: The car hasnt acted up, and runs VERY cool. Any ideas ... around the beginning of this year, if I find the receipt ... out that sensor too (where is it? someone said near #5 cyl ...
document.body:
Register Help Remember Me? What's New? Articles Forum New Posts FAQ Calendar Forum Actions Mark Forums Read Quick Links Today's Posts View Site Leaders Blogs Donate Gallery Picture Gallery Album Gallery Calendar Groups Chat Advanced Search Forum General W-Body Discussion General low coolant light If this is your first visit, be sure to check out the FAQ by clicking the link above. You may have to register before you can post: click the register link above to proceed. To start viewing messages, select the forum that you want to visit from the selection below. Page 1 of 2 1 2 Last Jump to page: Results 1 to 15 of 21 Thread: low coolant light Thread Tools Show Printable Version Subscribe to this Thread… Display Linear Mode Switch to Hybrid Mode Switch to Threaded Mode 10-01-2003,  07:38 AM #1 godofthunder View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Sep 2002 Posts 2,279 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light Ok...as in my post about antifreze...this light keeps coming on. Its really has only come on in the mornings, for the past 2 days. Itll stay on for a few miles (im thinking this is one of those switches where it trips, then stays on for a while, then resets). It will just happen out of the blue. Today, im going to take out the Radiator overflow...and rinse it out. THen, im going to top off that to the"fill"line. cutlassdude96 also mentioned the idea of the gaskets going. My dad also said that this stuff DOES evaporate over time. The car hasnt acted up, and runs VERY cool. Any ideas Jon 2006 Nissan Sentra SE Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  07:55 AM #2 sl3196 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Jun 2003 Location Gillette, Wy Posts 2,644 Thanks 1 Thanked 48 Times in 28 Posts low coolant light check radiator and resevior tank levels. Don't ever mix the green and orange coolant very bad blows gaskets. 2000 Grand Prix GTP Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  09:23 AM #3 Redfox340 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Dec 2002 Posts 2,206 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light Originally Posted by sl3196 check radiator and resevior tank levels. Don't ever mix the green and orange coolant very bad blows gaskets. No, mixing coolant creates a sludge which is a PITA to clean + fully remove. Godofthunder , make sure your Low Coolant Sensor doesn't have residual gunk on it. Careful on cleaning it; DO NOT use any type of solvent. A mild mix of water / Simple Green will do the trick. - Erik 2003 Volkswagen Jetta GLS 1.8 liter turbocharged 20v I4 - [AWP] " ...and, yes, I have been CEL free since August 18th, 2003 ..." Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  09:25 AM #4 92turboLE View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date May 2003 Posts 1,165 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light where is the sensor... my ligh has been on for a good 3 months now... always check levels and they are fine, but never could find where the sensor is for checking/cleaning/replacing.. - Justin Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  10:34 AM #5 sl3196 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Jun 2003 Location Gillette, Wy Posts 2,644 Thanks 1 Thanked 48 Times in 28 Posts low coolant light hey that's what my mechanic said that mixing them leads to gasket errosion. 2000 Grand Prix GTP Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  10:48 AM #6 Robby1870 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Nov 2002 Location Lexington, KY Posts 6,742 Thanks 0 Thanked 4 Times in 2 Posts low coolant light Originally Posted by 92turboLE where is the sensor... my ligh has been on for a good 3 months now... always check levels and they are fine, but never could find where the sensor is for checking/cleaning/replacing.. - Justin There is one right under the T-stat and one on the rear head, right by #5 cylinder. Should have one green wire coming from it Robby Robby Whitesell 2006 Pontiac G6 GT - 3500 V6 1985 Toyota Pickup DLX - 2WD - 2.4L I4 Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  11:04 AM #7 92turboLE View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date May 2003 Posts 1,165 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light the one right under the t-stat is actualy the temp sensor, i know this cuz i had to redo the plug on the wire harness for it cuz it broke off and for some reason, when i hooked up the scantool, it said that my coolant temp was -3000 degrees and was dumping like 10x the propper amount of fuel into the engine, i was getting like 5-6 mile to the gallon until i got that replaced. but thanks for the other location... i need to check that. - Justin Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  12:04 PM #8 DOHCRagtopguy View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date Aug 2002 Posts 946 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light Low Coolant sensor on my Cutlass is on the Passenger's side of the radiator, held on by a spring clip. If it gets covered with crud, it will come on even if your level is ok. Hope this helps out. Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  02:14 PM #9 luminator94 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date Aug 2002 Posts 625 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light When I found my 00 GA GT, I test drove it and the"Low Coolant"light had come on when I started the car. I was going to walk away from it right then cuz I'm picky like that and to me that tells me somebody didn't take care of the car, or there was some problems. So I popped the hood and seen that the coolant level was fine. Turned out the sensor at the bottom of the overflow tank was a little gunked over. Dealership threw a new one in for free, and everything has been fine since. Aaron 1998 GTP- 3800 SII Supercharged @ 50k
1997 Chevy Cav Z24- LD9 2.4L DOHC @ 85k
2007 Ford Fusion SEL AWD- 3.0L DOHC @ 4k Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  02:54 PM #10 Hippie View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date Jun 2003 Posts 295 Thanks 3 Thanked 1 Time in 1 Post low coolant light Using stop leak will coat the sensor and make the light come on too. ops: Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  03:01 PM #11 mfewtrail View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Forum Moderator Join Date Nov 2002 Location GA Posts 6,015 Thanks 4 Thanked 60 Times in 49 Posts '90 PONTIAC GRAND PRIX low coolant light Originally Posted by DOHCRagtopguy Low Coolant sensor on my Cutlass is on the Passenger's side of the radiator, held on by a spring clip. If it gets covered with crud, it will come on even if your level is ok. Hope this helps out. ditto, all low-coolant sensors are the same on w-bodies to my knowledge, hell the one on my 01 looks to be the same as the one on my 93 ..haven't confirmed w/ part number yet...anyways, I've heard it's common for the sensors to die and then falsely illuminate the low coolant light...happened in my 93 GP, I ordered a new sensor from gmpartsdirect around the beginning of this year, if I find the receipt/invoice I'll let you know what I paid so you can get an idea of what to expect to pay if you do replace yours(other option = unplug it and just check your coolant level frequently as you should anyway ) edit: by"unplug"I mean the electrical connector from the sensor itself...not unplug the sensor from the radiator as you'll have a mess on your hands after the car gets warm and sprays lots of coolant out of the hole...I'm sure you all know this, but it's a"just in case"warning 8) matt f. - '93 SE, '90 Black/tan TGP(#101 of 2,749),&'90 Red/tan TGP http://s2.photobucket.com/home/mfewtrail TGP 1/4 mile times 1990 TGP coupe VIN database Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  09:33 PM #12 cutlassdude96 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Aug 2002 Location Bloomington, Indiana Posts 1,609 Thanks 4 Thanked 14 Times in 11 Posts '96 OLDSMOBILE CUTLASS low coolant light also check the coolent level in the moring before leave for work and then again when you get home from work to see if theres is any change in the level. 4 + 4 + 2 = 10 for Oldsmobile 1996 Olds Cutlass Supreme SL IV 3100 RIP Oldsmobile 1897-2004 Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  11:01 PM #13 godofthunder View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Sep 2002 Posts 2,279 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light Yeah...my dad said that the sensor was prob. in/on the overflow tank. And in that tank, is some dark crud (uncle mixed the wrong coolant..and for some reason, this was never cleaned). So...i plan to take the resivor off...spray it down and rinse out....and reattach. Ill pull out that sensor too (where is it? someone said near #5 cyl..but i woudl think it was on the tank), and wipe it down. If you see that part number, please let me know. Id much rather it be something like this, rather than what cutlassdude said and that i could have a bad head gasket. Im going to read up in my haynes manual...see if i can find anything about the sensor...etc Jon 2006 Nissan Sentra SE Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  11:12 PM #14 cutlassdude96 View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Aug 2002 Location Bloomington, Indiana Posts 1,609 Thanks 4 Thanked 14 Times in 11 Posts '96 OLDSMOBILE CUTLASS low coolant light its on the pass side of the rad. and its the intake gaskets that could be going out not the head gaskets thats even a bigger mess. 4 + 4 + 2 = 10 for Oldsmobile 1996 Olds Cutlass Supreme SL IV 3100 RIP Oldsmobile 1897-2004 Reply With Quote 10-01-2003,  11:16 PM #15 godofthunder View Profile View Forum Posts Private Message View Blog Entries Visit Homepage View Articles Join Date Sep 2002 Posts 2,279 Thanks 0 Thanked 0 Times in 0 Posts low coolant light is thats whats happening to yours though? So ours is on the pass side of the radiator? not on the overflow tank? Ill have to look tommrow...i dont feel like draing part of the radiator to get to it... jon 2006 Nissan Sentra SE Reply With Quote Page 1 of 2 1 2 Last Jump to page: Quick Navigation General Top Site Areas Settings Private Messages Subscriptions Who's Online Search Forums Forums Home Forums Site Related Forum Rules&Guidelines W-body.com Announcements and News Forum Features Forum/Website Suggestions and Comments New Member Introductions General W-Body Discussion Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) W-body EBook Discussion General Powertrain Brakes/Suspension/Steering/Wheels/Tires Car Audio Appearance/Car Care Member's Rides Events Event Pictures and Videos Track Talk Specialty Forums Turbo Grand Prix TGPForums.com Cutlass Supreme Convertible Classifieds W-body For Sale or Trade / Wanted Links and deals W-body Auction Watch Group Purchases Other For Sale or Trade / Wanted « coolant leak help please | Changing rear brakes.. » Visitors found this page by searching for: 2002 pontiac grand am low coolant light ,  oldsmobile cutlass low coolant light ,  pontiac grand am low coolant light stays on ,  coolant light is on in oldsmobile cutlass supreme ,  pontiac g6 low coolant light Tags for this Thread car , coolant , gs , miles , post View Tag Cloud Posting Permissions You may not post new threads You may not post replies You may not post attachments You may not edit your posts   BB code is On Smilies are On [IMG] code is On [VIDEO] code is On HTML code is Off Forum Rules -- Wbody Theme 1 -- Wbody Theme 2 -- Default Mobile Style Contact Us The largest online community dedicated to General Motor's W-body Lineup of cars.
